review: We were a table of 7 with three kids/teens on a Wednesday evening. The waitress was outstanding and brought us fries to hold us over until the food came. There were endless refills on drinks without anyone asking. The menu has a large selection of choices and the food was tasty. A member of our party has a severe food allergy and forgot to mention it to the waitress and when the food came and she realized our error, she returned the food to the kitchen and put a new order in. No questions asked. The manager (Meredith) then came over to our table to let us know what they do to avoid cross contamination, etc. she was super friendly and showed the utmost concern for our table. Usually, this deadly allergy is dismissed by restaurants, and again, it was our fault for forgetting to mention it as we were all busy catching up with family, yet the staff went above and beyond to ensure our safety. Thanks again to the staff for making sure we were taken care of. This is the best service we have ever received at a local restaurant!

Very dissatisfied...... We come here all the time and normally this is a fast Curtis and fun place to come. Today however I'm very dissatisfied. It is black Friday and they are not even as busy as they are on a Tuesday mid-day. The hostess took forever to seat the 3 top that was in front of us. My wife took our 2 year old to the rest room ( we all know how that can go) 5 minutes minimum. Still my wife was almost to the front of the restaurant looking for us thinking we would have been seated. We were going to be seated with no apologies for the long wait. Sat down  and our drink oder was taken quickly. However not entered for another long time because my kids could not turn on the game until till the drink order was entered. On top of it all my daughter's drink Cam and had food stuck on the inside of the glass. If it was not for lemonade we would not have even seen it. Food cam and was good but Service was way below the normal.
Just no.  Service was bad and the food not good.  Limp Salad and a burnt burger.  Endless cold and soggy fries. Nope

We occasionally go to Red Robin once every few months as my wife enjoys the Gluten Free menu.  We went to the restaurant in Oswego, IL mid afternoon on New Year's Day.  The staff was friendly but not overly helpful.  There were long periods where they were not around and  drinks were refilled slowly.  My wife's burger was well done despite ordering medium.  The bacon was left off of my burger.  The staff never offered to refill the bottomless fries or Cole slaw.  We didn't complain as the food was tasty as usual.  The problem came when after dinner, I went to the bathroom.  The bathroom was in shambles I assume from the night before.  None of the stalls had any toilet paper, there were feces stuck to the toilet rim, the floor and walls were discusting and the paper towel dispenser did not work.  I paid my bill and departed the restaurant to find a bathroom I could use.  I did tell the hostess about the bathroom and properly tipped the waiter as none of it was his doing.  I assume being New Year's Day, the staff was the "B" team at least that was my impression.  I will not go back to that restaurant ever, but I will go to another Red Robin.

I have to admit I have a love/like relationship with Red Robin. When they first opened in the area the idea of "Gourmet Burgers" was a novelty, and since then there have opened many restaurants offering Gourmet Burgers. Many of the other burger restaurants are more upscale and Red Robin has attempted to up its game too.  Originally Red Robin catered to families with children, their mascot a Red Robin of course and they even had an employee dress in a large Red Robin costume. Since then, they have attempted to appeal to both families with children and adults who just want to enjoy a good burger without exuberant (read screaming) children.  The bar area is now adult only, leaving the rest of the restaurant family friendly.  They have even remodeled the restaurant to give it a more "almost" upscale feel to it, losing many of Red Robin's signature trade marks (upside down Psycho Movie picture previously found in all restaurants) along with other familiar photographs and Red Robin related kitsch. It almost works too! What would help to make it work would be tables in the bar that don't wobble, and how about free WiFi like your competition provides! Aside from that, your servers and bartenders are excellent! A shoutout to Adam, who does double duty as both the bartender and server! Their Royalty program is very worthwhile to join. Not only do you get a free burger for your birthday, they send you numerous money saving offers throughout the year. BTW, their burgers are excellent too! For the longest time I've fallen into a rut ordering their Whiskey River Burger or their Big Tavern Burger. I've recently discovered the Southern Charm Burger and have a new favorite. How can I resist candied bacon strips, black angus patty, honey BBQ sauce, light brown sugar glaze, carmelized onions, salt and pepper, xtra sharp cheddar cheese, and mayo if you like. I don't know what Jimmy Buffett would say, but with an ice cold beer for me, it's a Cheeseburger in Paradise!

Justin was our server. He was awesome. Kept coming back to check on us.  Mom and auntie were happy with the burger they shared. As long as they are happy, I am happy. I tried a couple of fries and thus were delicious.  I had a veggie Boca burger which was just ok. I also had a side salad.  Nothing amazing but great service.

Went in at 645 on a Monday night. Not too terribly busy. Waited at least 10 minutes and had 4 servers walk past us with not a single one acknowledging we were there, without drinks. Decided to leave and as we were walking to the car, the manager was standing outside smoking.

If you haven't heard, Red Robin has the latest craze in burgers - ramen burger!  Ok, maybe not the latest, but it's only been a thing for about year or so.  I didn't see any mention of it on their website (weird), but they have it!  Beginning 4/4/2016, they added Red Ramen Burger as a limited edition item for $12.  I didn't have high hopes for this and came with low expectations.  It's been a few years since I've been to RR and never to this location.   We came on a Wednesday night and there was no wait.  The hostess seated us in the bar area for dinner where they were playing the Hawks game on the big screen.  Service was cheerful and friendly.  They also have the computerize pads at each table so you can view the menu, add additional items to the order, call for service or pay with a credit card.  It also prints out a receipt or email it to you.  For a place this advanced, I'm surprise that they don't have a garbage can next to the bathroom door.  Where am I supposed to throw out my paper towel after I use it to open the door? They have many different kinds of burgers on the menu and the gourmet ones range from $10 - $15 and they come with bottomless steak fries. Red Ramen Burger $12 -  The burger was mad decent.  The ramen buns were deliciously crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  You'll have to eat it rather quickly or the bottom bun will get soggy, although it was good that way, too.  It was a little difficult to eat and messy, but I would do it again.  This burger was jammed packed with flavor and yummy grease.  It comes with chili-infused shredded cabbage, carrot, onion and deep fried jalapeno peppers. Berserker X Burger $11 - This was another limited edition burger that comes with Sriracha onion straws, sweet spicy pickles, cheddar on brioche bun.  It was good, nothing fancy. Not Your Father's Ginger Ale Beer $5.49 - This beer is recommended to be served over ice and it was pretty refreshing.
STILL NO WIFI ?!?! what is this the middle ages?!?! food ain't THAT good, that they not have the internet !!!! not coming back til they do ugh.

Won't be going back. We hadn't been here in over a year when we received coupons in the mail. Today I ordered coffee and asked the waitress to make a new pot if it wasn't fresh. She said sure! She bought me coffee but apologized they didn't have cream so she bought a glass of milk. I fixed my coffee and surprise the coffee was cold! She brewed a new pot. The tortilla the used for my wrap was so dry I couldn't chew it. No thanks .. we won't be back.

Once again, #redrobin in Oswego was a really great place to take the kiddos! They sat us in a kid friendly section (so their loud noises were the norm and not the exception ), they were VERY quick with the food delivery, and they understood that we didn't want to dilly dally. It was a really great experience for us! Our waitresses was fantastic. Food was very good as well.  We'll definitely be going back!

It happened.  It finally happened.  We were hungry, and I said, "I just don't want tacos.  I'm getting a little tired of tacos."  I'm sure it will only be another week before I change my mind, if even that, but we decided we wanted a burger and a cold beer. We didn't want to drive far, and I wasn't feeling really adventurous about trying something new, so we decided on Red Robin.  It's predictable, yes, but it's also reliable for good, affordable food.  It's a notch above fast food/fast casual, but a notch below the gourmet burger places.   Red Robin tries though.  There is a variety of burgers on the menu to choose from, and my favorites are the Whiskey River BBQ or the Peppercorn burger.  Both are packed with flavor.  Red Robin is also known for their bottomless French fries, and this location isn't as chintzy about the portions as others. The beer list is decent, but definitely in that notch below gourmet category.  You won't find many craft beers at Red Robin, more like Sam Adams or Blue Moon.   I never leave Red Robin with the feeling that I can't wait to come back, but I do leave Red Robin having had a satisfying meal at and affordable price.

The food is good, not great, but good. I do think they're a little pricey. This was my second visit and it was much better than the first. The restaurant was clean and we were able to be seated right away in the bar area. Pub Mac and cheese is really good, if you want chicken it's an extra $3 - and not worth it. Boyfriend got a burger, said it was good, but he's one of those RR fans and raves about it. I think this place is simply average and a little pricey. It's essentially fast food in a sit down restaurant. Good but not great by any means. I left full and satisfied but it's not a place I'll be rushing back to. I have to add - they have the WORST guacamole I've ever had. Do NOT and I repeat do NOT get the guacamole burger!!!

My husband and I came here for his birthday (his choice) and had a good time. Being the old people we are, we arrived for dinner at 5:30 pm on a Tuesday. No wait at all and quick service. They first tried seating us at the bar, but there was a booth and a high chair..um..no thanks. We went to a booth instead. Walking through the bar, there were several couples seated there, so I guess that's where you sit if you're a duo.  Our server was quick and friendly. I had some sort of southwestern salad which was delicious. Pretty large, should've been on a larger plate. The plate it arrived on was a little small in that once I started eating the salad, the lettuce started falling off the plate once it was being rearranged. Drinks were good, and they sang happy birthday. Overall, a good experience for a weeknight dinner.

I used to go to Red Robin a lot when I was younger. Now, they've changed their look, and it's nice. But Lately the food hasn't tasted right, it tastes off. The caesar salad doesn't taste very good. But the sweet potato fries were pretty good. It's a nice restaurant and are popular for their burgers though. While this restaurant used to be good for me, I'm not a big fan of it anymore.

I ordered the fish (cod) sandwich, with bottomless fries. I opted for the bottomless side salad (no extra charge). The fish is very good and doesn't flake apart. I mean, look at its golden crust!  I was displeased with the presentation of the $5 chips guacamole and salsa. I mean, it tasted good and the chips were still hot coming out to the table, but the stand holding the items was architecturally displeasing to the eye.  I only come here since my family enjoys their food, but I normally do not eat burgers so it isn't up my ally and I resort to the other burger-less options.  Overall: pretty decent!
Bottomless fries and chips. Great spinach dip. Love their BBQ chicken sandwiches and root beer float.

So. I'm sitting in this restaraunt now. My fries that I basically had to beg for (supposedly endless) and they are hard and somewhat old. It's Saturday!!!!! It's packed!!!!! Nothing should be old. I want to complain to the manager but I'm not even sure its worth it. I just know I won't be back. I asked for no pink in burger but just I'm not sure if my mind is playing tricks but my husband and I both think we see pink. The one positive is my son liked his chicken strips from kids menu. On the upside: it was my son's birthday and he got free ice cream and they sang to him. Gave one more star for that.

Love Red Robin and especially love this location. Went today with my fiancé and had a couple drinks and a meal. Before our food came the manager came to our table to say she was sorry the food was taking so long, but neither my fiancé or myself thought it was taking long. She returned immediately with our food and also gave us $10 off our meal to our surprise. Good food, great service, and great atmosphere.

Went here b/c of their sensitivity to food allergies. We talked to the server & the manager. We were presented a menu and selected the options we needed to avoid: eggs, milk, nuts. Ordered the plain turkey burger for my kiddo & after she bit into it, she said the sauce tasted funny. Of course it did! There's EGG in it. Terrible, terrible, terrible mistake! They tried to correct it -how do you do that after serving a known allergy to a customer who has done their due diligence and notified all responsible parties involved?! Will never go back to a Red Robin again. Avoid this place if you have food allergies/sensitivities! Sure, they may get it right once or even a few times with no history of mistakes for you personally, but 1 screw up is all it takes. Why take that chance???

They did such a nice job with our friend's little girl on her birthday.   The waiter and manager really went out of their way to make it special.  There was an issue with my rewards card and the manager took care of it and reissued my card.  The decor had been updated and is more adult friendly.  We had stopped going there because I felt I was at Chuck e cheese.  Now there is a better balance between the kid and adult experience.  Plus, the burgers were very good as well as my wrap and who can go wrong with unlimited fries???
The food,  drinks and atmosphere are very nice.  The service was "good". I gave only 4 stars mostly because its "slightly" overpriced.

Was near my brother's place and needed some real food. Since I like the Arctic Cod fish and Chips at another Red Robin I thought I'd give them a try at this location. I arrived shortly after 9:15 pm on a Friday and was immediately seated in the bar area. The tall Guinness I ordered was presented with a decent head and it was adequately chilled. My main order came out pretty quickly and was consistent with other franchise locations. The fish was a light golden brown shade and tasted correctly. The bottomless fries were hot and lightly salted.  The dill sauce was cold like it is supposed to be. While I was eating, I observed the dining room.  The area was clean and appropriately lit. The condiments at my location were adequately supplied. The noise level was a touch on the loud side, especially since I was seated under a speaker. The server checked on me several times to ensure any special needs or requests were addressed. Overall, my experience was on par with other RR franchise locations. I would return to this location if I lived in the area.

Visited Oswego location with my son fir lunch on friday, server was very attentive, very knowlegable! Nate was or server.... I've been a server for 22 years I always love complimenting great service!!!! I will definitely ask for Nate every time I come in!!!!

My sister and I enjoyed our visit there several weeks ago sorry the other reviews say differ.  The service was pretty good and the host was great.   My burger was excellent very tasty.   Yes it was a bit loud full of children but it's a burger franchise not a place to watch a game.  Good place to go if you are looking for a very casual atmosphere. Maybe I should do reviews the day of or day after lol maybe I would have more details :)

My daughter just loves this place so I find myself here more than I would like.   I enjoy the place, the restaurant is always clean and neat and the staff is always, 100% of the time fantastic.  However, there is only so much red robin you can eat.  The food its to be expected and good for what they serve, but i just think the menu is a little boring and non exciting.   The quality of the food they do server and the staff professionalism, i give this location 4.5 stars, but i only gave it a 3 because i cringe every time my daughter says "lets go to red robin"

Do yourself a favor and pass! I've always heard great things about RR so when the family said this is where we were meeting up, I was down. Service was kind of shabby, our server was also the bartender. A group member asked for their special lemonade and it came out in a really small cup with only 2 strawberries, when she asked for more strawberries it not only took 10 minutes, but they acted like she had committed a sin. The burgers were lackluster and bland, we all definitely agreed on that. I probably would never go to a Red Robin again after this service and food. Oh and the fries never got refiled...so much for bottomless?

Not a bad place to go for a game or something. The service is a little slow, but our server was super friendly and it was really busy so it was not really an issue. I feel like this Red Robin has a little too much going on at once inside that kind of made me a little dizzy, but other than that everything was good. The food was pretty good. The endless fries are really neat and I would definitely go back.

Times heals all wounds -anonymous So I haven't eaten at a Red Robin for approximately 8 years, which was the first..and last time I ate there.  At the time, I had a burger and fries at the Woodfield location.  While eating, I thought the food was average-- nothing special but I wasn't expecting my socks to be knocked off. Fast forward five hours and I was hurling in my (now ex) bf's yard as soon as I got out of the car.  That being said, I was truly afraid to patronize RR and did not do so until this past Friday night. This review is for the takeout only:  it was not good.  I do give them credit for somewhat complying with my picky order (Avo Cobb salad: no chicken or bacon, dbl egg, romaine lettuce) but that's about all. Avo Cobb salad:  modified as indicated above.  This salad was essentially all lettuce, with a sparse amount of avocado (think two small-ish slices of avocado), a sprinkling of diced tomatoes, a relatively generous portion of chopped egg, and olives...which were just weird.  They didn't really fit in the salad.  It would have been much better had more veggies been added, perhaps some cucumber and onion.  Also, they did not include the bread that was supposed to come with the salad or any salad dressing, which they had specifically asked me about over the phone.  That's inexcusable, regardless of whether or not you (the reader) think I'm a moron for ordering a salad at RR.  Anyhow, it was lettuce overload and almost had a weird chemically taste to it.  Grosssssssss.  So much for trying to eat relatively healthy. My bf ordered two items:  the Burning Love burger (w/ fries) and the Cheeseburger Con Queso.  Of course I didn't try either of these but I did ask him for a full review of said items. Burning Love burger:  not big enough (patty), not spicy enough, the breaded jalapeno slices were soggy, and he didn't even finish it (which is very surprising for this man).  Overall, fail. Cheeseburger Con Queso:  well, when he took it out of the bag, it basically looked like a half filled container of congealed cheese and partially digested beef.  He said the chunks of hamburger were too big, it wasn't flavorful and it was also room temp.  They do give you lots of multicolored chips though. His fries didn't even look appealing.  Usually I'll steal one (or several) fries from him but they just looked limp, undercooked, and tasteless so I didn't even bother.  He agreed and was underwhelmed, remarking "well, this must be why we never go there"...see, it sucks. Overall, I would have to say I'll never return to a RR.  They don't have a decent healthy veg/pescatarian option, the food was not warm enough when we picked it up (we were on time and still stood at the bar waiting for them to put it together), and why the HELL would we spend $26.89 on this crap when we could get a better value through the Portillos drive thru a couple store fronts down? Fool me once, shame on you..fool me twice, shame on me.  I should have known better, and for that..I grant two stars to RR.

walked in, no one was at the host stand. waited for a couple of minutes. (DIDN"T MIND) was seated where i wanted to be seated. server was on me right away (30 seconds) food was quick, and hot. after eating, i sat there for an hourish, NOBODY COMPLAINED, (YAY). paid and left.

I typically try to stay away from chain restaurants as I find most of the food at these restaurants are not as good, however, I like Red Robin for taking the kids out.  The burgers are always good as are their chicken sandwiches.  Also, they have a great GF bun which is great for my gluten intolerant boys.  The prices are decent, on the slightly high side, but the quantities are huge.  My only complaint is that we usually order as take out and the have screwed up our orders several times now.  One of the times using regular buns rather than the requested gluten free.  We didn't notice until we got home and when we called the Manager said she would send a gift card in the mail.....which never happened.  That was disappointing.  We now make sure to check the order before we drive away.

It's a corporate he'll hole. The restaurant was full, correction FULL of children, the greeter was a robot and the food was bland (I had jalapeño burger)  The server spent more time going thru her corporate lingo on how they may be able to obtain my email address than really caring about what we wanted to eat and the way we wanted to be treated.  If you want a burger and to see and hear screaming children, go hit the golden arches.  I've eaten at RedRobin before, and I don't think this particular store is the norm. This location is a bust.

This used to be one of our family's favorite places to eat.  A couple of years ago they had a rather significant price increase on just about everything on their menu (20-25% on most items) and from then on it became a far less worth while place to go.  We continued to go however because we liked the food and the kids enjoyed it.  Lately however, they have hired a slew of high school girls with an attitude to act as most of their hostesses and servers.  Asking for a different booth brings on a slew of sighs and comments, followed by horrible service.  It is certainly not worth dealing with for a now somewhat overpriced, very loud and obnoxious place to eat with average food at best.

Over the last couple years I've given Red Robin a couple chances. Unfortunately, I find myself leaving disappointed every time. Both their burgers and service are average at best. For the price the charge for a burger and fries, you could actually get a good burger from somewhere else. This past weekend we had three cokes, two burgers/fries and we walked out spending over $30. Not worth it in my humble opinion.  I will not be returning.

Used to be worth the stop, good food & decent service. Not much interest anymore. Like most chain restaurants, after they establish themselves in a location, the quality starts to drop. I'm not afraid to pay for a great tasting meal. But now it's just over-priced hamburgers. What a shame.

I normally try to stay away from the chains but it was late and we just wanted a nice sit-down restaurant without spending too much money. The menu had several burger choices (among other things) and it was hot, juicy, and flavorful. Cooked perfectly, and topped with just the right amount of everything ordered. The onion rings on the side and the fries were just the right crispness and hot. I could not have asked for anything better for the food ordered. They were also very cooperative with the tv channel selections for our sports teams. A nice evening out.

Call it 2 1/2 stars... Red Robin has some good points.  First off, it's the Chuckie Cheese of burger joints!  On weekend days, it's always loaded with kids having a great time.  RR goes out of their way to make sure kids have a great time there and I commend them on that. I've also had some decent tasting food there too.  But the food quality and the overall feeling I get about the place is a bit on the inconsistent side.  It's difficult for me to put my finger on however, their chief competitor down the street, Culver's is better by a long shot in my view. The service at RR can be spotty too.  I've had great servers, I've had annoying, pestering servers, and there have been times where I've wondered where mine went. The temperature setting at the Oswego restaurant needs to be looked into too.  Generally, I like it cool in the restaurant but it can be downright freezing in there at times!  It was so cold on one trip, I actually requested the manager warm the place up a bit.  Keep in mind, I'm a person who sleeps with a ceiling fan blowing on me in February. I waffled over caving and making their score 3 stars but in the end, I can't justify the maximum score for fast food (I won't give more than 3 stars for fast food or pizza) due to their inconsistency - and consistency is a critical trait to have if you want to stay alive in the restaurant business these days.

They have great food and great drinks.  One of a kind burgers and menu.  I had a waitress by the name of Justine and she was just great.  An extremely happy and helpful worker who makes the dining experience outstanding. A great place to grab a burger and sip on some cocktails.

Always love going here for the bottomless fries and great burgers. If your into trying different burgers this is the place for you. While I will deeply miss the burger with the cheese stix on it I'm sure my heart will thank them for taking it off the menu. The service however at this location can very. Last night I swear our waiter had the hots for the girl at the table next to us because they got great service while we were pretty much ignored. My only other complaint is every time I go there I swear there are at least 4 or 5 birthdays and they scream that birthday song. Over all the food here is great although a but a bit on the pricey side for what you get.

I like Red Robin. They have a pretty good selection of burgers that hit the spot every once in a while. My problem with this location is that they have a faulty fire alarm that the restaurant cannot deactivate. I have seen fire trucks there multiple times and I have been eating there when the alarms went off. The manager explained the problem and probably would have comp'd our meal if we hadn't finished eating before the alarms started sounding.  Another time I ate there and the food was too hot. The restaurant was relatively empty, which probably explains why there was a problem. I ordered chili before my meal and it was too hot to eat even after I was done eating my burger. I like my food fresh, but this was taking it to a new level.

I have been to this Red Robin location a few times. It's clean and the interior is newer compared to other red robins. On this occasion we ordered the spinach and artichoke dip and a couple of burgers. The chips that come with the dip must be made in house because they were nice and warm and not too salty. The black and blue burger was cooked well and had a good amount of flavor. The chibatta bread it was on was tasty. Sweet potato fries were good as well. Our server was prompt and courteous. The only complaint I had was the food took a little long to come out even though it wasn't very busy. Overall a good experience. Will return. Come check it out!

We live across the street and decided to try the restaurant when it first opened - had a couple burgers which seemed a little pricey and the waiter helped himself to more money by changing our bill and adding more of a tip for himself. When we discovered this on our credit card bill we went back and let the manager know of the theft - we received the balance back in cash but not as much as an apology or an offer to make things right. We haven't been back since. It was homecoming night and we wonder how many other young people were ripped off by that restaurant's waitstaff.
The service is excellent, but the food isn't very good. Small portions and my fish was soggy.

Red Robin..."back in the day" was a place to go after work to meet with friends and have drinks and dinner. Weekends were a fun place to go after shopping during the day or dinner after  movie. Now it is filled with screaming kids running around unattended. It literally feels like you've stepped into a daycare center. It doesn't matter which Red Robin you go to. Being from Seattle, I wonder if it's just different here in the Midwest? Anyway- Service and food below par any more. As another person mentioned bottomless fries are suppose to be just that. Don't come out with 10 fries and disappear until you come back with my bill. The staff is more interested in their social time than the customers. I can't see ever going back unfortunately. Everything about Red Robin needs to be changed.

Last night we decided to go to red robin with some family.  My husband and I have been here before and have always had a good experience.  We got the onion rings as an appetizer.  They were delicious and there were a good amount in the order for our group of 5 to share.   I got the a1 burger.  It was very yummy!!! My only complaint is that the onion straws are so thin that they get a big stringy and are hard to bite off. The fries are good, but since they are bottomless they only give you a few to start.  Realistically it's probably the perfect amount to partner with a burger but I always like a lot of fries!! Haha.  The service is great and the restaurant is always clean.

My boyfriend and I came here last Thursday because I had an extremely stressful week and I wanted to relax. It started off great but ended on quite the sour note. Short story waitress visited us three times prior to food, once food arrives we never saw her again. I am giving it two stars because we enjoyed our meals. 2.5 would be a better choice if I could make a half star review.  We got there and ordered drinks. I had the sangria, he had a Sprite. I also ordered a water. We ordered our food and we loved our meals. I had the buzz clucks and Mac and he had a burger. Once we got our food we never saw the waitress again, not even for our check or the bottomless fried that came with my boyfriends meal ... Which he wanted more of!!!! And never got!! I really wanted to order another drink. I stated to use the digital screen to try and figure out how to get more food. I pressed the button to "call server" and it was flashing red for a couple minutes, no one came. So I took matters into my own hands. Sure I could have taken the time to figure out how to use the stupid screen but I got so frustrated I decided since I could pay my bill digitally, and since it was the only thing I figure out how to do quickly ... I paid my check and we left. I would have probably ordered two more drinks and dessert if I wasn't so frustrated and didn't feel ignored. She didn't get a worthy tip at all because I was so pissed off... I had a crappy week, this didn't help.  Oddly enough as soon as I scanned my card to pay ... There she was asking us if we needed anything. Too late. Perhaps all of this technology is a really bad idea? I mean I can just pay my bill and not have to wait around for a server to hand me a piece of paper. And no one can try and fix a terrible experience since I am in complete control of when I pay my bill.  Oh I also love that auto tip feature because that was easily adjust down ... Probably would have given her zero tip but I don't think these stupid digital menus are entirely her fault. I hope your corporate office reads this.  The other table adjacent too us was visited 3 more times than we were (maybe they used the screen?) really wish this turned out differently.

Quick update to my review. Red Robin saw my original review and they reached out to me to try to make it right. They sent me a gift card to come back in and give them another chance. We did go back in and this time ordered one of their tavern burgers and fries. This time the burger was cooked perfectly and the fries were hot and not cold. A much better experience than the last time.  The service was slow which was strange as it was memorial day and the restaurant was pretty slow. That said, the server was very nice and the food was enjoyable. I'm happy that the experience the second time around was far better than the first!

Good food and good service.  Burgers are excellent.  They have a lot of different sides if you don't want fries.  Good place to take the family or friends.  The have a bar off to the left when you walk in.  I will be back!

The BF and I came here for the Tavern Special today only to find out that the tavern menu doesn't include anything outside of beef in which I was informed by Justin it was because Red Robin doesn't have any other burgers which came in 2oz. I suppose I understand that, I also understand that you cannot accommodate everyone no matter what you offer. However, I would think if you offered a special it would include something that was not beef in which there are plenty of other options. I do believe a 2oz turkey burger could easily be made if nothing else. The food was pretty good and the server rocked.

Red Robin, a very meh place that tries too hard and is a bit overpriced.   They have tons of crazy burgers, which is great done get me wrong, but we live in Chicago people...you can get great burgers everywhere AND they wont be so expensive.  I mean right down the street is Portillos who makes a wicked burger believe it or not, and culvers who also has a good burger.   I think of this place as a once a year type craving.  When I get the craving its all I can think about until we go there.  Then the minute we are done we are like..."why did we do that, that was stupid"   I have been to a few of these in a few different states and I will say they are consistent.  So if you have had experience with Red Robin and you like them, then this place will not disappoint.   For me though its a bit pricy for what you get and a bit too commercial (even though they are trying very hard to be retro) REEEEEEEED ROBIN....Meeeeeeeeeeh (Read that to the melody of their commercial, its funny right?)
We always have good food and service here. I like that they seat the children away from the bar area.

Hostess/Hosts very friendly and quick to seat even though it's Valentine's Day and busy. Travis (I think thats his name, name tag faded)brought us our food with a smile and asked if he could get us anything else. We sat at a table in the bar. Male & Female bartenders were most interested in talking to each other and servers. They were talking loudly across the bar area .  They had servers congregating from the dining rm at end of bar and complaining about schedules, etc... Female bartender was very verbal that one girl who was complaining, tell the manager 'how it is'. The server was swearing and said she has no Sun night avail, but she is on the sched.  Never saw a manager.

This place is quite good for what it offers.  The burgers are good, service is good too, but what surprised me was the steak sandwich.  It's not that big, but it was delicious.  I was so surprised, I ordered it to go and was quite happy.  I would go back for that steak sandwich any time, and a burger too.  It is what it is and it does it well!

They were very accommodating to dairy, egg and tree nut allergies. We ordered the simple burger ketchup only but apparently stay away from the fires if you have a dairy allergy as it is listed as containing dairy in the seasoning salt.

So, it had been quite a while since I've eaten here, years. I wasn't a fan of the burger I had. Went back a few weeks ago and tried a turkey burger...it was Delicious! Each bite was better than the last. They endless steak fries were fresh and our waiter was great. I'm actually looking forward to going back.
I've always had a great experience at Red Robin. Plus they offer a free burger for your birthday which is a bonus in my book. Their garlic fries and freckled lemonade are the best!

For a Saturday afternoon this location was not to busy and my husband and I waited all most 15 minutes and got NO service. So we left the two manager that looked right at us did nothing did not say a word to is as we walked out.

We gave them another chance, and well, they did better.  In fact, we've gone back SO many times, the manager recognizes us (because we eat there a lot)  and makes sure our order is correct and the few times it has not been, its been comped. :)  They've been really good about accomodating my daughter's food allergies as well.

Granted it is Saturday (5:30pm), and it's pretty crowded, but the service and experience was terrible. We got our appetizer before getting napkins and silverware...had to ask for those. Food took exceptionally long, and my meal was not warm. All of our fries were soggy. We had to ask for refills multiple times. There was no toilet paper in my stall and no paper towels to dry hands (women's restroom). Very disappointing experience.

This is my favorite Red Robin location. The service is always great and the staff is very well informed on allergen concerns of the customers. I am Gluten free and every time I've been there they take extra precautions to make sure I get my food correctly.  Kudos to the management for teaching their staff that customer service is key to a successful business.

The last few times my family and I have been there I have been disappointed with the food. I ordered a fresh fruit cup and got a cup of canned pears, canned mandarins, and frozen strawberries. Horrible. Then we ordered the molten lava dessert with FRESH strawberries and again with the frozen strawberries. BUY FRESH FRUIT! That was the last time for us there!

I was really excited about there vegan burger and a prospect of new vegan menu. After writing red robins directly I relized there food choices for me fell flat they have a vegan burger but no vegan bun and no other vegan choices. Despite this I still enjoyed going in every now and then for a burger. Everytime I went it was really good or terribly aweful. I desided its best to save money and cook up my own vegan food at home.

My husband and I stopped in on a Wednesday night. We waited a while to be seated as there was no one at the hostess stand. After a hike around the restaurant we were seated at a 4 top. After a wait our server showed up and took our order. We ordered cocktails and an appetizer. After a wait of 15 minutes we were served. We then placed our dinner order. Long story short...people who arrived after us were being served. Our server apologized ovet and over but it was never clear where the problem was. The most frustrating thing was that the "manager" a young man of about 22 kept walking around as if to be supervising. The t.v.s in the restaurant was showing a story of a young man who'd lost his leg to cancer. That was followed by nude modeling. Prime time family hour...no way. this place is a waste of money. We were there for 2 hours....2 hours too long.

I'm now convinced that I'm a glutton for punishment. I've been to this location many times and it's always slow and they seem to have perfected luke warm as a serving temperature. I wouldn't mind slow if it was also hot.

We've tried this particular Red Robin several times and finally decided that we won't be returning. The food is decent but overpriced and the service is horrible. Takes forever to get food or refills and there is always something wrong with our order. And this may sound strange but the last two times we were in (Jan 2001 and Sept 2011) the restaurant was SO cold that we had to eat with our coats on and we still froze. I've been to a few other locations and while the service and environment were much better, the food is still overpriced in my opinion.
I love a good red robin. This one is a good one. The staff is nice and the food is good. A little overpriced I feel but still a good experience.

It's a little better than Chili's or Friday's, quite a bit better than Applebees, but it's a huge kid-suitable chain restaurant.  The burgers were pretty good - mine tasted like it had sat in marinade perhaps, but they have one of those annoying burger cooking policies where they wont cook them to order.  "Do you want some pink or no pink?"  The slap-it-on-the-ass-and-walk-it-by-the-grill people are out of luck.  Since we tend to go to these places at the kids' request, I asked my six-year old daughter for a quick testimonial.  Alex sez:  'I liked it.  Our waitress said that on Tuesday there would be a person in a costume of the Red Robin, from the restaurant Red Robin, walking around and waving and giving kids hugs.  So I want to go there, especially on Tuesday.  I liked the food because it was tasty and because it came from my favorite restaurant, and this time was my first time there.'
Great service, nice outdoor patio. Love their shakes and 5-Alarm burgers.
It's just OK.  Way too much mayo on burgers, but it is kid-friendly and fast.
